Billings.Four Dances Natural Area: Four Dances Natural Area is 765 acres (310 ha) of undeveloped open space which were preserved in Billings, Montana, and became public land. The area was named after Chief Four Dances, an important religious and military figure in the history of the Crow Nation. The name in the Crow language is Annishi Shopash, translated as "Place of Four Dances".
